GOD.content: heart as light, photology, because it is spiritual, not earthly, it cannot hide, cannot be encrypted, an omnipresence more radical & effective than a spy satellite
GOD.linkedContent: heart as light, photology, because it is spiritual, not earthly, it cannot hide, cannot be encrypted, an omnipresence more radical & effective than a spy satellite

GT.content: a “true” corpus is still, perhaps, counterfeit money, may be ghost or spirit, spirit of body & of capital (title, heading, is capital), no problem of canon if this institution were natural
GT.linkedContent: a “true” corpus is still, perhaps, counterfeit money, may be ghost or spirit, spirit of body & of capital (title, heading, is capital), no problem of canon if this institution were natural

GT.content: in Mauss, ghost & spirit linked in same time, same scene
GT.linkedContent: in Mauss, ghost & spirit linked in same time, same scene

FL.content: spirit as police hauntings, spirit as dictatorship

SPOM.content: commitment of justice, to whom? to life (natural life, life of spirit) of living being > that this is irrefutable carries justice beyond present life, non pas vers la mort mais vers une sur-vie, where life & death are traces of traces
SPOM.linkedContent: commitment of justice, to whom? to life (natural life, life of spirit) of living being > that this is irrefutable carries justice beyond present life, non pas vers la mort mais vers une sur-vie, where life & death are traces of traces

SPOM.content: alors il y a de l’esprit, des esprits, et il faut compter avec eux > le plus d’un
SPOM.linkedContent: alors il y a de l’esprit, des esprits, et il faut compter avec eux > le plus d’un

SPOM.content: when spirit becomes specter, an instant of flesh and phenomenality, an apparition
SPOM.linkedContent: when spirit becomes specter, an instant of flesh and phenomenality, an apparition

SPOM.content: three things which decompose the single thing (spirit, specter, king): 1) mourning, localize, identify the dead, know who and where [ontology, hermeneutics, philosophy] 2) language, voice, “scull had a tongue in it” 3) work, “spirit of the spirit” is work, spirit works
SPOM.linkedContent: three things which decompose the single thing (spirit, specter, king): 1) mourning, localize, identify the dead, know who and where [ontology, hermeneutics, philosophy] 2) language, voice, “scull had a tongue in it” 3) work, “spirit of the spirit” is work, spirit works

SPOM.content: pluralize spirit, send a welcome to specters
SPOM.linkedContent: pluralize spirit, send a welcome to specters

SPOM.content: “to be present” not un mot d’esprit, but le mot de l’esprit > the first verbal body
SPOM.linkedContent: “to be present” not un mot d’esprit, but le mot de l’esprit > the first verbal body

SPOM.content: semantics of Gespenst haunt semantics of Geist
SPOM.linkedContent: semantics of Gespenst haunt semantics of Geist

SPOM.content: [re: Eighteenth Brumaire: “conjure up spirits of past”] convoking (beschwören) spirits as specters, le geste d’une conjuration positive, celle qui jure pour appeler et non pour refouler
SPOM.linkedContent: [re: Eighteenth Brumaire: “conjure up spirits of past”] convoking (beschwören) spirits as specters, le geste d’une conjuration positive, celle qui jure pour appeler et non pour refouler

SPOM.content: “we” will not please Marxists, insisting on the spirt of Marxism as spirits in the plural and in the sense of specter, allowing untimely specters to come back
SPOM.linkedContent: “we” will not please Marxists, insisting on the spirt of Marxism as spirits in the plural and in the sense of specter, allowing untimely specters to come back

SPOM.content: btwn spirit & specter, tragedy & comedy, difference of time btwn 2 masks
SPOM.linkedContent: btwn spirit & specter, tragedy & comedy, difference of time btwn 2 masks

SPOM.content: spirit of past [not ghost?] convoked to anesthetize itself (sich betäuben), protects against its “own content,” protects against itself, makes you forget why and that you’re violent
SPOM.linkedContent: spirit of past [not ghost?] convoked to anesthetize itself (sich betäuben), protects against its “own content,” protects against itself, makes you forget why and that you’re violent

SPOM.content: acc. Marx, to call forth spirit and dismiss ghosts is to phantomalize, bewitch oneself w/ spirit
SPOM.linkedContent: acc. Marx, to call forth spirit and dismiss ghosts is to phantomalize, bewitch oneself w/ spirit

SPOM.content: acc. Marx, the ghost effect not only spiritualization, autonomization of spirit, idea, or thought (Hegelian idealism), but also supplementary moment after autonomization, one more simulacrum is added: a body, flesh (Leib)
SPOM.linkedContent: acc. Marx, the ghost effect not only spiritualization, autonomization of spirit, idea, or thought (Hegelian idealism), but also supplementary moment after autonomization, one more simulacrum is added: a body, flesh (Leib)

SPOM.content: Marx’s theory of ideology: the “second” ghost > incorporation of autonomized spirit [“first” ghost?], ideological (fetish) lent a borrowed body [see DEBT], second incarnation “conferred on an initial idealization,” a non-natural body, a technical body or an institutional body (helmet of ideologem or fetish under armor)
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx’s theory of ideology: the “second” ghost > incorporation of autonomized spirit [“first” ghost?], ideological (fetish) lent a borrowed body [see DEBT], second incarnation “conferred on an initial idealization,” a non-natural body, a technical body or an institutional body (helmet of ideologem or fetish under armor)

SPOM.content: that’s not all: specificity of process can still capitalize spectralization > the first ghost effect (autonomized spirit) can be incorporated, negated, integrated as one’s own human body
SPOM.linkedContent: that’s not all: specificity of process can still capitalize spectralization > the first ghost effect (autonomized spirit) can be incorporated, negated, integrated as one’s own human body

SPOM.content: via Marx, all phenomenology is phenomenology of spirit, cannot hide its Christian vocation
SPOM.linkedContent: via Marx, all phenomenology is phenomenology of spirit, cannot hide its Christian vocation

SPOM.content: difference btwn specter and spirit is differance, specter is > carnal apparition of spirit, its phenomenal, fallen, guilty body, impatient, nostalgic waiting for redemption, for spirit
SPOM.linkedContent: difference btwn specter and spirit is differance, specter is > carnal apparition of spirit, its phenomenal, fallen, guilty body, impatient, nostalgic waiting for redemption, for spirit

SPOM.content: ghost would be deferred spirit, promise or calculation of an expiation > this differance must be reckoned w/: it upsets all calculations, interests, capital > a transition btwn 2 moments of spirit, the ghost just passing through [see Hamacher, “Lingua Amissa,” Futures: Of Jacq.., p. 165]
SPOM.linkedContent: ghost would be deferred spirit, promise or calculation of an expiation > this differance must be reckoned w/: it upsets all calculations, interests, capital > a transition btwn 2 moments of spirit, the ghost just passing through [see Hamacher, “Lingua Amissa,” Futures: Of Jacq.., p. 165]

SPOM.content: passage of “spirits,” “offspring of spirit” > spectrality of everything (Gespensterhaftigkeit Aller)
SPOM.linkedContent: passage of “spirits,” “offspring of spirit” > spectrality of everything (Gespensterhaftigkeit Aller)

SPOM.content: if every specter is distinguished from spirit by a quasi-incarnation, an incorporation, then Christ is most spectral of specters
SPOM.linkedContent: if every specter is distinguished from spirit by a quasi-incarnation, an incorporation, then Christ is most spectral of specters

SPOM.content: there is always more than one commodity, more than one spirit, # belongs to the movement of the commodity
SPOM.linkedContent: there is always more than one commodity, more than one spirit, # belongs to the movement of the commodity

A.content: pass from hostage to host/guest from host/guest to ghost in series: hostage, host, guest, ghost, holy ghost, Geist
A.linkedContent: pass from hostage to host/guest from host/guest to ghost in series: hostage, host, guest, ghost, holy ghost, Geist

A.content: all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage
A.linkedContent: all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage

VP.content: living speech (spirituality of breath as phonē) preserves ideality and presence [in face of language’s game of presence/absence]
VP.linkedContent: living speech (spirituality of breath as phonē) preserves ideality and presence [in face of language’s game of presence/absence]

VP.content: the “as such”: totality of body, of mundane, totality of the spatial, the visible > not worked over (ne sont pas travaillés) by Geist, which transforms Körper into Leib
VP.linkedContent: the “as such”: totality of body, of mundane, totality of the spatial, the visible > not worked over (ne sont pas travaillés) by Geist, which transforms Körper into Leib

VP.content: Geistigkeit needs no signifier to be present to itself; writing is an incarnation that needs spirit, speech, thought to be animated
VP.linkedContent: Geistigkeit needs no signifier to be present to itself; writing is an incarnation that needs spirit, speech, thought to be animated

OH.content: Heidegger’s Entmachtung of spirit > destitution of Europe
ideality in capitalization: that which exceeds borders of sensible, opens onto infinite, gives rise to universal, “maxim of maximization,” nothing other than spirit itself (analogic)
OH.linkedContent: ideality in capitalization: that which exceeds borders of sensible, opens onto infinite, gives rise to universal, “maxim of maximization,” nothing other than spirit itself (analogic)

OH.content: spirit as exemplary example, example par excellence, of value (source of value)
Valéry makes analogy btwn spirit, value & capital [refers to Nietzsche]
via Valéry, originary & transcategorical character of spirit, original spiritualism a logocentrism born in Mediterranean
OH.linkedContent: via Valéry, originary & transcategorical character of spirit, original spiritualism a logocentrism born in Mediterranean

OH.content: Valéry: the word “spirit” > first commerce of the world [logocentrism]
OH.linkedContent: Valéry: the word “spirit” > first commerce of the world [logocentrism]

PPHS.content: Aufhebung facilitates spirit’s elevation beyond that within which it was submerged, sublimates nature into itself > presenting itself to itself as such
PPHS.linkedContent: Aufhebung facilitates spirit’s elevation beyond that within which it was submerged, sublimates nature into itself > presenting itself to itself as such

PPHS.content: Egyptian immortality of soul—close to Hegel’s freedom of spirit
PPHS.linkedContent: Egyptian immortality of soul—close to Hegel’s freedom of spirit

PPHS.content: despite symbol’s identity, sign’s arbitrariness is closer to independence, freedom of spirt than external, natural symbol [Saussure concurs in footnotes]
PPHS.linkedContent: despite symbol’s identity, sign’s arbitrariness is closer to independence, freedom of spirt than external, natural symbol [Saussure concurs in footnotes]

PPHS.content: Hegel: creative memory, mnēmosynē, freely bestows on sign a value that only has value conferred on it by spirit > [because sign is arbitrary, unlike symbol, it resonates w/ spirit, solely]
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: creative memory, mnēmosynē, freely bestows on sign a value that only has value conferred on it by spirit > [because sign is arbitrary, unlike symbol, it resonates w/ spirit, solely]

PPHS.content: for Hegel, signifying substance is sound, “substance of expression” [glossematicians], most proper to be produced as time itself, sound relève from naturalness, linked to spirit’s relation to itself, the voice
PPHS.linkedContent: for Hegel, signifying substance is sound, “substance of expression” [glossematicians], most proper to be produced as time itself, sound relève from naturalness, linked to spirit’s relation to itself, the voice

PPHS.content: acc. Hegel, when ideality appears in nature: spirit hides itself outside itself in sensory matter
PPHS.linkedContent: acc. Hegel, when ideality appears in nature: spirit hides itself outside itself in sensory matter

PPHS.content: classical take on writing as “practical exterior activity,” as that which “comes to the aid” condemns all mnemotechniques, all langue machines, all supplementary repetitions > life of spirit is thusly forced to emerge from its interior
PPHS.linkedContent: classical take on writing as “practical exterior activity,” as that which “comes to the aid” condemns all mnemotechniques, all langue machines, all supplementary repetitions > life of spirit is thusly forced to emerge from its interior

PPHS.content: Hegel: human voice sounds w/out external impulse, out of one’s own feelings, spirit
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: human voice sounds w/out external impulse, out of one’s own feelings, spirit

PPHS.content: acc. Hegel, silence of writing, space of calculation, interrupts movement of Aufhebung, interiorization of past (Erinnerung), history of spirit
PPHS.linkedContent: acc. Hegel, silence of writing, space of calculation, interrupts movement of Aufhebung, interiorization of past (Erinnerung), history of spirit

PPHS.content: sign is essence of symbol, the symbol past, both in turn relevé by living concept, language w/out language, language become thing itself, voice murmuring in greatest proximity to spirit, identity of the name, of Being
PPHS.linkedContent: sign is essence of symbol, the symbol past, both in turn relevé by living concept, language w/out language, language become thing itself, voice murmuring in greatest proximity to spirit, identity of the name, of Being

WM.content: via Du Marsais, the philosophical metaphor light of the spirit is a detour w/in (in sight of) reappropriation, presence, etc. (from Platonic eidos to Hegelian Idea), a trope, a borrowed dwelling (house) > here, light is one metaphor among metaphors, and borrowed dwelling, expropriation, becomes metaphor of metaphor
WM.linkedContent: via Du Marsais, the philosophical metaphor light of the spirit is a detour w/in (in sight of) reappropriation, presence, etc. (from Platonic eidos to Hegelian Idea), a trope, a borrowed dwelling (house) > here, light is one metaphor among metaphors, and borrowed dwelling, expropriation, becomes metaphor of metaphor

P.content: art forms only one of the circles in the great circle of Geist, revenant (circle of art, circle of religion, circle of philosophy)
P.linkedContent: art forms only one of the circles in the great circle of Geist, revenant (circle of art, circle of religion, circle of philosophy)

FS.content: absence & haunting of divine sign (Jewish God) [cf. GOD], anguish of Hebraic ruah (pneuma), regulates modern books/criticism/aesthetics
FS.linkedContent: absence & haunting of divine sign (Jewish God) [cf. GOD], anguish of Hebraic ruah (pneuma), regulates modern books/criticism/aesthetics

FS.content: writing, not a determined pathos, an empirical state of writer, but responsibility of angustia: [Derrida is privileging a power of equivocality over creativity of classical God, anguish connoting a narrowing, a loss of breath, a restriction, constraint, and thus the anguish of choice]
FS.linkedContent: writing, not a determined pathos, an empirical state of writer, but responsibility of angustia: [Derrida is privileging a power of equivocality over creativity of classical God, anguish connoting a narrowing, a loss of breath, a restriction, constraint, and thus the anguish of choice]

O.content: Hegel: spirit is a trinity, but cannot be counted (counting is a bad procedure)
O.linkedContent: Hegel: spirit is a trinity, but cannot be counted (counting is a bad procedure)

O.content: for Hegel, life is essential philosophical determination of concept & spirit (vegetal, biological traits), organicity of encyclopedic logic [inborn germ of death]
O.linkedContent: for Hegel, life is essential philosophical determination of concept & spirit (vegetal, biological traits), organicity of encyclopedic logic [inborn germ of death]

Gii.content: Geschlecht, in Fichte, is/inhabits living language of inspirited breath vs. dead language torn from its root
Gii.linkedContent: Geschlecht, in Fichte, is/inhabits living language of inspirited breath vs. dead language torn from its root

Gii.content: acc. Fichte, children learn language as if signs for sensible things were arbitrary (willkürlich) > must reconstitute past development of national language
Gii.linkedContent: acc. Fichte, children learn language as if signs for sensible things were arbitrary (willkürlich) > must reconstitute past development of national language

Gii.content: Heidegger employs idiomatic untranslatability of opposition btwn geistig/geistlich to withdraw Gedicht (“site”) of Trakl from Platonic tradition, w/ its opposition aisthēton/noeton (“sensible” material/“intelligible” spirituality), and from Christian opposition spiritual/temporal
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger employs idiomatic untranslatability of opposition btwn geistig/geistlich to withdraw Gedicht (“site”) of Trakl from Platonic tradition, w/ its opposition aisthēton/noeton (“sensible” material/“intelligible” spirituality), and from Christian opposition spiritual/temporal

Gii.content: Heidegger’s Geist (gheis): lifted, transported out of oneself, like a flame
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Geist (gheis): lifted, transported out of oneself, like a flame

TR.content: Rousseau abjures Protestantism (freer, more intentionalist, more spiritual), he converts mechanically to more mechanical, ritualistic Catholicism
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau abjures Protestantism (freer, more intentionalist, more spiritual), he converts mechanically to more mechanical, ritualistic Catholicism

IW.content: acc. Cohen, Kant: holy of holies, innermost sanctum (die innerste Verwandschaft) of German spirit & Kant represents most intimate affinity w/ Judaism
IW.linkedContent: acc. Cohen, Kant: holy of holies, innermost sanctum (die innerste Verwandschaft) of German spirit & Kant represents most intimate affinity w/ Judaism

IW.content: this kinship (Kant, German, Jew) is sealed in most intimate depth, most essential interiority, is sacredness itself, historical sacredness of spirit
IW.linkedContent: this kinship (Kant, German, Jew) is sealed in most intimate depth, most essential interiority, is sacredness itself, historical sacredness of spirit

IW.content: for Cohen, Reformation placed German spirit at center of world history (in den Mittelpunkt der Weltgeshichte)
IW.linkedContent: for Cohen, Reformation placed German spirit at center of world history (in den Mittelpunkt der Weltgeshichte)

IW.content: faithful heir of Platonic hypotheticism: cult of doubt, suspicion of dogma, culture of interpretation, free interpretation (free from institutional authority)
IW.linkedContent: faithful heir of Platonic hypotheticism: cult of doubt, suspicion of dogma, culture of interpretation, free interpretation (free from institutional authority)

IW.content: slogan (Schlagwort) of Reformation: to give account (logon didonai) & justify
IW.linkedContent: slogan (Schlagwort) of Reformation: to give account (logon didonai) & justify

IW.content: it’s as if Cohen tells Jews/Catholics: recognize the Protestant spirit that already inhabits you: a demand for hypothesis, truth, science, beyond instituted dogma [Jewish & German]
IW.linkedContent: it’s as if Cohen tells Jews/Catholics: recognize the Protestant spirit that already inhabits you: a demand for hypothesis, truth, science, beyond instituted dogma [Jewish & German]

IW.content: Fichte’s great “discovery”: ego cogito is national, Self is social, in essence a national Self, cogito not formal [Kant] but in relation to other, a history, a language, substantially national
IW.linkedContent: Fichte’s great “discovery”: ego cogito is national, Self is social, in essence a national Self, cogito not formal [Kant] but in relation to other, a history, a language, substantially national

IW.content: “I” signs first in its spiritual language
for Fichte, conversely, nation is an ego > relates to itself via egological subjectivity
IW.linkedContent: for Fichte, conversely, nation is an ego > relates to itself via egological subjectivity

IW.content: truth of nationality is German idealism; the German spirit is the spirit of humanity
IW.linkedContent: truth of nationality is German idealism; the German spirit is the spirit of humanity

IW.content: music as highest, most ideal art, its structure is pure breath, spiritus and psyche
IW.linkedContent: music as highest, most ideal art, its structure is pure breath, spiritus and psyche

EL.content: Scholem protests against Christianizing Messianism, interiorizing & spiritualizing, a flight seeking to escape verification of Messianic, apocalyptic claim
EL.linkedContent: Scholem protests against Christianizing Messianism, interiorizing & spiritualizing, a flight seeking to escape verification of Messianic, apocalyptic claim

EL.content: Germans (Kant) think French combine Geist and Witz in Esprit

C.content: bananas [re: Titus-Carmel’s The Great Cultu…] would be copies of copies w/out example, phantasmata, if force of ductus did not carry the remainder beyond any phantasy, beyond the signature, proper name, nameable [cf. pp. 220-21 also beyond hierarchy]
C.linkedContent: bananas [re: Titus-Carmel’s The Great Cultu…] would be copies of copies w/out example, phantasmata, if force of ductus did not carry the remainder beyond any phantasy, beyond the signature, proper name, nameable [cf. pp. 220-21 also beyond hierarchy]

C.content: ductus’ [?] contingency accounts for ideality of model, which always rises, fermentation of spirt (Geist), above an organic decomposition
C.linkedContent: ductus’ [?] contingency accounts for ideality of model, which always rises, fermentation of spirt (Geist), above an organic decomposition

TN.content: for Aquinas, spiritual touching, pure act, no intervallic medium (transcends value of affect), not temporal but eternal: like pure act or Prime Mover, a touch foreign to sensibility: (ordinary/extraordinary) history of Christian language
TN.linkedContent: for Aquinas, spiritual touching, pure act, no intervallic medium (transcends value of affect), not temporal but eternal: like pure act or Prime Mover, a touch foreign to sensibility: (ordinary/extraordinary) history of Christian language

TN.content: Christian body as post-sin, post-Incarnation historical body
divine spirit as flame, sets itself on fire, figure of love & desire which spiritualizes hapto-onto-theo-teleology of Christian flesh > highest possibility
TN.linkedContent: divine spirit as flame, sets itself on fire, figure of love & desire which spiritualizes hapto-onto-theo-teleology of Christian flesh > highest possibility

TN.content: the becoming-love of Aristotelian desire (orxeis) [?], spontaneity of a causa sui
TN.linkedContent: the becoming-love of Aristotelian desire (orxeis) [?], spontaneity of a causa sui

TN.content: spacing & “distance” are thought by Chrétian [by Christian theology of flesh], reduced to phenomenology of finitude, que le toucher spirituel (infini, immédiat, etc.) aura commencé par élever et relever [differance serving to close closure]
TN.linkedContent: spacing & “distance” are thought by Chrétian [by Christian theology of flesh], reduced to phenomenology of finitude, que le toucher spirituel (infini, immédiat, etc.) aura commencé par élever et relever [differance serving to close closure]

TN.content: Pascal: true sacrifice must be spiritual—the flesh that doesn’t perish [circumcision of heart]
TN.linkedContent: Pascal: true sacrifice must be spiritual—the flesh that doesn’t perish [circumcision of heart]

TN.content: letter (touchable), spirit (untouchable), Jews/Christians—who touches more? Hegel’s hardness of Jews

AD.content: spectral aura of face, figure of Geist, ghost, urgent before “real” qualities > recognize other w/out waiting: exceeds, deconstructs ontological positions
AD.linkedContent: spectral aura of face, figure of Geist, ghost, urgent before “real” qualities > recognize other w/out waiting: exceeds, deconstructs ontological positions

AD.content: no hospitality w/out chance of spectrality; God uncontaminated by Being: rigorous definition of the Face, le tout autre > as spectral as it is spiritual? gives orders, gives pardon
AD.linkedContent: no hospitality w/out chance of spectrality; God uncontaminated by Being: rigorous definition of the Face, le tout autre > as spectral as it is spiritual? gives orders, gives pardon

CF.content: for Hegel, all is forgivable except crime against spirit, against reconciling power of forgiveness
CF.linkedContent: for Hegel, all is forgivable except crime against spirit, against reconciling power of forgiveness

CIN.content: cinder & smoke (fumée): smoke gets lost w/out perceptible remainder, spirited away, sublimates; cinder falls (tombe), lets go, heavy, more material because it fritters away its word: it is very divisible
CIN.linkedContent: cinder & smoke (fumée): smoke gets lost w/out perceptible remainder, spirited away, sublimates; cinder falls (tombe), lets go, heavy, more material because it fritters away its word: it is very divisible

OG.content: interior holy voice of faith; natural law, native unity of voice & writing is prescriptive, commandment > good writing comprehended as that which had to be comprehended
OG.linkedContent: interior holy voice of faith; natural law, native unity of voice & writing is prescriptive, commandment > good writing comprehended as that which had to be comprehended

OG.content: non-phonetic hieroglyph (Leibniz, Chinese) menaces history/life of spirit because menaces substantiality, breaks the noun (nom) apart > describes relations not appellations
OG.linkedContent: non-phonetic hieroglyph (Leibniz, Chinese) menaces history/life of spirit because menaces substantiality, breaks the noun (nom) apart > describes relations not appellations
